meanings.definition: The state or quality of being torrid.
meanings.sent1: The torridnesses of the desert made it unbearable to walk outside.
meanings.sent2: She could feel the torridnesses of his anger radiating off him.
meanings.sent3: The torridnesses of the debate left everyone feeling exhausted.
meanings.sent4: The torridnesses of her emotions burned brightly in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The torridnesses of the fire engulfed the entire building.

meanings.sent1: The torridnesses of the summer sun made the pavement too hot to touch.
meanings.sent2: Their torridnesses for each other was evident to everyone around.
meanings.sent3: The torridnesses of the argument could be felt in the air.
meanings.sent4: The torridnesses of his gaze made her cheeks flush.
meanings.sent5: The torridnesses of their love kept them warm on cold nights.

meanings.definition: The hottest part of the year.
meanings.sent1: During the torridnesses, people sought refuge in air-conditioned buildings.
meanings.sent2: The torridnesses of summer in this region can be overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The torridnesses of the season made ice cream a popular choice.
meanings.sent4: In the torridnesses, even the flowers seemed to wilt under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The torridnesses of the day made it perfect for a swim in the cool lake.
